oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: John Booker Kennedy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: John Booker Kennedy (1841-1913), who was a charter member of the Ku Klux Klan.

Born in Giles County in 1841, he moved to Lawrenceburg in 1871, before returning to Pulaski in 1884. In 1884, he was elected Circuit Court Clerk of Pulaski and served for 22 years. He was described as a man with an "all-absorbing devotion to the South and to Southern ideals." He served in the Confederate Army in the 3rd Infantry from 1861-1865.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Men
